title: Mayor Pete Is the Man to Beat
summary: So why don't his rivals press him on the specifics of his record in South Bend?. After Pete Buttigieg's surprise win in Iowa, you'd think his rivals would be searching for his weak spot. The irony is that it's right out in the open where it's always been: his record as mayor of South Bend, Ind.

title: The Cow Dung Cure for Coronavirus
summary: Indian nationalists peddle something worse than snake oil.. India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote this week to Xi Jinping, offering the Chinese leader help in tackling the Wuhan coronavirus. Details of the assistance aren't public, but Mr. Modi's offer probably didn't include supplies for a "treatment" that a senior Hindu fundamentalist advocated recently.

title: The Cold War Over Venezuela
summary: Moscow has a stake in Maduro's regime, but its value to Putin depends on oil.. There weren't many bipartisan moments in last week's State of the Union address. Most Democratic legislators sat on their hands as President Trump hailed overall rising wages as well as record low unemployment for African-Americans, Asian-Americans and Hispanics. But in a move that testifies to the humanitarian and geopolitical concerns Venezuela presents, Democrats and Republicans rose together to applaud Juan Guaidó, the president of Venezuela's National Assembly, who is recognized as the country's legitimate ruler by nearly 60 nations including the U.S.

title: 'Abandoned' Review: No Foothold on a Future
summary: "Opportunity deserts" appear in both urban and rural areas-places where young people can't ﬁnd a good education or earn a decent living.. To become adults and arrive at economic independence, Anne Kim writes, young people first "need to have met their basic needs for shelter, food and safety." It's an interesting and, in one reading, a slightly off-center construction hinting at the passive voice. In another era, one might have said that young adults need to meet their basic needs. But here the needs must be "met." By whom, to what extent and for how long are the questions at the heart of "Abandoned: America's Lost Youth and the Crisis of Disconnection."

title: Trump Wants to Double Spending on AI, Quantum Computing
summary: White House budget calls for annual spending of $2 billion on AI and $860 million on quantum within two years. The White House on Monday proposed roughly doubling nondefense research-and-development spending on artificial intelligence and quantum information sciences, citing fierce global competition, while cutting overall funding for R&D.

title: Fed's Daly Says Low Jobless Rate Not Automatic Sign of Tight Labor Market
summary: The San Francisco Fed leader says letting the jobless rate fall to very low levels has had big benefits. San Francisco Fed leader Mary Daly said Monday super low unemployment doesn't necessarily mean the job market has overheated, and added she sees no looming need to change the central bank's interest-rate target any time soon.

title: Can a Design Contest Fix the Brooklyn Bridge? Cyclists Hope So.
summary: Resume Subscription. For years cyclists and pedestrians have jockeyed for space on the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Nevada Democrats Tight-Lipped About Vote-Counting Plans
summary: Ahead of Feb. 22 caucuses, party isn't answering questions about process and technology it plans to use. The Nevada Democratic Party is still working on its process for conducting and transmitting the results of its Feb. 22 caucuses and has been unable to answer questions about how that will be carried out, causing alarm among volunteers and campaigns.

title: Testimony in Weinstein Case Casts Doubt on Sex-Assault Claims
summary: Harvey Weinstein's defense team elicits testimony aimed at undercutting claims that the Hollywood producer sexually assaulted multiple women. Harvey Weinstein's legal team on Monday questioned two women whose testimony appeared aimed at undercutting the Hollywood producer's multiple accusers and raising doubts for jurors at his New York rape trial.

title: Trump's America Is Committed to Europe
summary: A major exercise involves 40,000 troops, of which more than three-quarters come from the U.S.. Soon 20,000 U.S. soldiers will arrive in Europe. They will bring tanks, armored vehicles and other equipment. Even as some Europeans claim the trans-Atlantic relationship is unraveling, the U.S. is about to launch its largest military exercise in Europe in more than a quarter-century, known as Defender Europe 20. The first stages began earlier this month, and the exercise will continue through the spring. The next step should be a similar endeavor by the Europeans themselves.

title: Klobuchar Draws Crowds in New Hampshire After Standing Out in Debate
summary: Resume Subscription. NASHUA, N. H.-Amy Klobuchar declared her campaign was surging-and to make sure supporters got the message, she repeated it at most of her events.

title: Australian Dollar Sinks as Investors Brace for Coronavirus Slowdown in China
summary: The currency, one of the worst-performing this year, fell to its weakest level since March 2009. summary: E-commerce and technology giant says president steered huge cloud-computing contract away from Amazon. title: Trump Proposes $4.8 Trillion Budget, With Cuts to Safety Nets
summary: White House would boost funds for defense and veterans, and aims to reduce deficits over a decade in part through curbs on Medicare and Medicaid. WASHINGTON-President Trump's $4.8 trillion budget charts a path for a potential second term, calling for steep reductions in social safety-net programs and higher outlays for defense and the space program, while assuming tax cuts will be extended.

title: Schick Owner Abandons Takeover of Harry's Following FTC Suit
summary: Antitrust challenge derails proposed $1.37 billion razor merger. The maker of Schick razors said it abandoned plans to buy upstart rival Harry's Inc., a week after the Federal Trade Commission sued to block the $1.37 billion deal.

title: Court Puts Hold on New Rule Cracking Down on Brokers Fees
summary: A state court temporarily halted new regulations on apartment rental broker fees on Monday, giving thousands of New York City real-estate brokers a reprieve. A state court temporarily halted new regulations on apartment rental broker fees on Monday, giving thousands of New York City real-estate brokers at least a period of relief from a new rule many said threatened their business.

title: Hostile Spies Target U.S. With Cyber, Encryption, Big Data, Report Finds
summary: U.S. counterintelligence strategy sees challenges from foreign governments, criminal groups, hacktivists. WASHINGTON-Intelligence threats against the U.S. are becoming more complex, diverse and harmful as adversaries turn to innovative hybrid techniques combining traditional spying, economic espionage and cyber operations to steal U.S. secrets, according to a government report released Monday.

title: XPO Logistics Hires New CFO As It Weighs Asset Sale

summary: Women held 32.4% of board seats and 15% of finance chief roles at FTSE 100 firms in 2019. title: New York State Sues Trump Administration Over Global Entry Ban
summary: Attorney General Letitia James says Homeland Security Department violates constitution by barring New Yorkers from enrolling. title: Turkish Troop Losses Mount After Clash With Assad Forces
summary: Five soldiers die in fighting with Syrian forces; Ankara pledges to keep supporting rebels targeted by government offensive. Five Turkish soldiers were killed during a clash with Syrian government forces in northwestern Syria, raising the country's troop losses to 13 over the past week and testing Turkey's resolve to support rebels in an area that President Bashar al-Assad has vowed to reclaim.

summary: Simon to own 80% of the Taubman operating entity when transaction is completed. title: Equifax's Treasure Trove of Data Made It a Target of State Actors
summary: The Equifax breach stood out because there was little evidence the stolen data had resurfaced for sale on the dark web. title: Coronavirus Toll on Shipping Reaches $350 Million a Week
summary: Falling volumes and canceled sailings hit container shipping, bulk operators face falling industrial demand. title: Fed's Harker Says Rates Should Remain Steady
summary: The Philadelphia Federal Reserve leader said the U.S. economy is in a good place and he sees no reason for the central bank to change its interest-rate target for now. title: This Whistleblower Really Was a Hero
summary: The communist regime labors to contain a virus-and the freedom to discuss it.. Some people have the physical courage to put themselves at risk of injury or death to help others. And then there is the moral courage of a person who insists on speaking the truth. Dr. Li Wenliang, who passed away on Friday at age 33, possessed both kinds of courage in abundance. And even in death, he is now forcing the dictator of China to conduct an emergency public-relations campaign in the face of a growing demand for free speech.

title: Dropping Classes for Cause or for Slacking
summary: When I attempted to drop an elective course,the professor said: "No, you must finish the course, everything in life is not interesting or relevant.". It may be a sign of the times that Prof. Daniel F. Chambliss allows students to drop his sociology course midterm with little discussion ("Go Ahead, Drop My Course," op-ed, Feb. 3). From personal experience, I would be concerned that this shows lack of regard for the undergraduate's future development.

title: Medici Would Be Skeptical on Student Loans
summary: I rather doubt the Medici would offer a loan to an 18-year-old, let alone someone who vapes, binge drinks and never had a history of employment.. Prof. Jackson Toby's "14th-Century Solutions to Student Debt" (op-ed, Jan. 29) raises the issues of maturity, character and trustworthiness in awarding student loans. I rather doubt the Medici would offer a loan to an 18-year-old, let alone someone who vapes, binge drinks and never had a history of employment. It's common knowledge that the two most important characteristics of wealth accumulation over one's life are education and marriage. A 1980s congressional study on the return of investment to the government from the GI Bill found a return of seven to one. For every dollar invested in our Greatest Generation, the GI Bill participants returned seven dollars in tax revenue over the course of their lifetimes. They were military veterans who exhibited proven maturity and character.

title: Patents Must Promote, Not Hurt, Innovation
summary: Contrary to the founder's intent, some patents appear to slow innovation rather than encourage it.. I disagree with Paul R. Michel and Matthew J. title: Let's Give Warren Harding Credit for the Good He Did
summary: Let's recognize accomplishments such as lowering taxes, balancing the budget, paying down the national debt and the treaties of the Washington Conference on the Limitation of Armament 1921-22.. Regarding Kyle Peterson's "Warren G. Biden Might Win in '20" (op-ed, Jan. 25): I would point out that while President Harding did indeed run on the campaign slogan "return to normalcy" (as well as "think of America first"), in the discussion of the brief Warren administration's accomplishments, Mr. Peterson highlights the "Teapot Dome" scandal. I hope Mr. Peterson, and most current historians, would recognize accomplishments such as lowering taxes, balancing the budget, paying down the national debt and the treaties of the Washington Conference on the Limitation of Armament 1921-22.

title: The Liberal Solution to AB5
summary: Carl Szabo notes the bitter irony of AB5 and the fate of many liberal freelance journalists in California-layoffs and income loss caused by the very law they had supported.. And it generally holds true.

title: Videogame ETFs Are in Growth Mode
summary: Fund investors who want to bet on the fast-growing videogame industry now have more choices than ever. Exchange-traded-fund investors who want to bet on the fast-growing videogaming industry now have more ways to do it than ever before.

title: Which Way to Buy Gold: The Metal or the Companies?
summary: Bullion has many advantages for long-term investors, experts say. But for those who want to bet on the current rally, gold-mining stocks may be preferable. After years stuck in the doldrums, gold is back in fashion. A common question from individual investors is, should they put their money into the precious metal itself or gold-mining stocks?

title: Vanguard's Next Step: U.K. Retirement Accounts
summary: The fund giant's international expansion will continue with a SIPP platform. Vanguard Group is preparing to launch a retirement-account product in the U.K., the latest step in the U.S. fund giant's international expansion.

title: Passive Investing Gains Traction in Europe
summary: European investors appear to some to be tired of paying high fees for actively managed funds that don't hit their targets. The European appetite for exchange-traded funds has increased, and BlackRock iShares continues to dominate with the largest market share.

title: Instead of Buying Put Options, Some Investors Opt for 'Leaps'
summary: Though it's not for everyone, the Leaps strategy can be a less-costly alternative to buying 'put' options. With the stock market at historic highs and volatility close to all-time lows, some investors are considering taking their gains in their stock and ETF positions and buying long-term call options called Leaps (Long-term Equity Anticipation Securities).

title: An ETF of Hedge Funds (or Close to It)
summary: ASI HFRI-I Liquid Alternatives Ucits Fund, which trades on the Irish Stock Exchange, provides access to four core hedge-fund strategies, at a much lower cost. U.K.-based Aberdeen Standard Investments, a $670 billion asset manager, is carving out a new way for institutions and individuals to gain hedge-fund exposure.

title: Swiss ETFs Remain a Refuge
summary: Funds focused on Swiss equities have had a good year, helped by their status as a haven. Investors consider Switzerland to be a relatively safe, steady and stable economy, and analysts expect exchange-traded funds exposed to Swiss equities to continue to shine in 2020 as a result.

title: What Are 'Nongrowth' Stocks and 'Bond Surrogates'?
summary: Nongrowth stocks are those in the basic materials, energy, financial and industrials sectors. Bond surrogates pay hefty dividends. Analysts at Wolfe Research see a pattern between the two groups.. Sometimes it seems the language Wall Street uses to describe the market changes almost as much as the market itself. That can make reading research reports confusing.

title: Sanders Campaign Seeks Re-Canvass in Iowa After Buttigieg Wins More Delegates
summary: Iowa Democratic Party's updated results show Buttigieg projected to win 14 delegates, while Sanders will get 12. The Iowa Democratic Party Sunday released updated results from its presidential caucuses last week that showed former Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., was projected to win 14 delegates to July's national convention in Milwaukee, while Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders will get 12.

title: Coronavirus Concerns Spread Faster and Further Than Pathogen
summary: Resume Subscription. A deadly new coronavirus has spread to two dozen countries from China. So far, Iceland isn't one of them.

title: Coronavirus Death Toll Tops Fatalities From SARS
summary: Death toll tops 900 in mainland China. BEIJING-The death toll from the new coronavirus outbreak has now surpassed that of the severe acute respiratory syndrome, or SARS, epidemic nearly two decades ago, as the number of fatalities topped 900.

title: Oscar's Biggest Comeback: the Blockbuster Nominee
summary: Many of this year's best-picture nominees are also box-office hits, in a change from past years. Before the Academy Awards crown their best-picture winner Sunday night, one group has already claimed an Oscar victory: box-office hits.

title: Democrats Turn Combative to Gain Edge in New Hampshire
summary: Resume Subscription. NASHUA, N.H.-The Democratic presidential candidates blitzed the Granite State in a final bid to energize supporters and win over independent voters who could sway the outcome of Tuesday's first-in-the-nation primary.

title: SEC Seeks to Curb Shareholder Resolutions
summary: Companies say resolutions pose undue burdens; small investors defend them as a pillar of shareholder democracy. WASHINGTON-It is a yearly ritual for American corporations: executives of Fortune 500 companies appearing at shareholder meetings to answer investors' concerns about everything from board membership to climate-change policies.

title: Need for Face Masks in China Pushes Auto, Energy Firms to Make Them
summary: GM venture, Foxconn, Sinopec use assembly lines to produce protective gear to fight coronavirus outbreak. China's auto makers, the world's biggest iPhone assembler and even state-owned energy companies are using their assembly lines to pump out more face masks and other medical supplies as the country responds to a coronavirus outbreak that has spread around the world.

title: Gov. Cuomo Doubts 'Socialist' Sanders Can Win White House
summary: New York governor calls socialist label 'a big pill for a lot of voters to swallow'. WASHINGTON-Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he doesn't believe U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders is the best Democratic candidate to beat President Trump and said it is too early to determine who the party's standard-bearer should be.
